title.narrative: Listen Learn and Live. Rights-Based approach empowering families and communities for sustainable wellbeing and livelihood.

description.narrative: The overall objective of the project is to contribute to the reduction of the cycle of poverty and violation of human rights in Nakawa division of Kampala and Kira Sub-County of Wakiso District in Uganda.The most vulnerable people in these communities are faced with poor health their income still remains low they continue to rely on obsolete technology and have not been able to use available resources to come out of poverty. These challenges have caused insufficient livelihood in households and further expo sed the most vulnerable people to the cycle of poverty. The project will consider the following cross-cutting development objectives:Gender, ensuring that women and men enjoy equal rights in all sectors. Human rights, empowering the most vulnerable to clai m their rights. Environment, promote practices that ensure sustainable use of environmental resources. Disaster and risk management, build the capacity of communities to be able to respond to disaster appropriately.The project will develop the already exis ting structures.The final beneficiaries will be 3900 members of 600 the most vulnerable households. 450 of these households were mobilized and given various skills during the previous phase of this project. This phase will add an other 150 households. Thes e people are composed of the widows single mothers the elderly People Living With HIV and AIDS People Living With Disabilities Orphans and other Vulnerable Children etc.The key activities shall be:Strengthening the capacity of the communities to improve on their basic health careProviding skills in sustainable resource mobilization to households and communitiesMotivating households to take advantage of modern technology and efficiently use resourcesLeading households groups and communities in exploiting ava ilable resources for self-sustainability.
